business.headline: 'Rich Dad Poor Dad' author warns of giant market crash, bets on gold and BitcoinAccording to Robert Kiyosaki the rising gold, silver, and Bitcoin prices show that traditional ways of saving—like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and ETFs—are no longer safe.

Should you buy HAL, BEL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks? Check price targetDefence companies are expected to do well for many positive reasons. These include higher government spending on defence, tensions between countries, a longer list of defence products being made in India, etc.

Explained: Why HDFC share price surged 4% today and what next?HDFC Bank's share price rose as the country's largest private lender, along with several other banks, cut its deposit interest rate by 25 basis points.

IndusInd Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI: Why banking stocks are rising todayShares of IndusInd Bank gained above 6% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), while HDFC Bank was up 3.3%. Axis Bank shares rose nearly 3% and ICICI Bank was up 2.3%.
Markets in green amid Trump's tariff rowStock market benchmark indices surged on Tuesday as trading resumed following a long weekend, with auto sector stocks leading the gains.

Is Quess Corp share price down over 50%? Not quite, here's what happenedWhat investors are seeing now is the adjusted market value of Quess Corp after the spin-off. The value of the new entities will be discovered once they are listed on the stock exchanges in the coming weeks.

Tata Motors, M&M, Maruti: Why are auto stocks gaining today?Tata Motors led the pack with a gain of over 5%, while Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) climbed nearly 4%. Maruti Suzuki advanced close to 2%, and other prominent names such as Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto, and Ashok Leyland rose over 1.5%.

Sensex, Nifty rally 2% in early trade. 5 things investors need to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tata Motors led the gains on the Sensex, jumping 5.03% in early trade. Other auto stocks such as Mahindra & Mahindra also performed well, rising 3.74%.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market gain amid positive global cues?Stock market today: Trading on Dalal Street remained shut on Monday due to Ambedkar Jayanti. As trading resumes, investors are hopeful that the markets will continue their positive trend from Friday, when both Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 2%.

Stocks to watch on April 15: Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDAKey stocks to watch on April 15 are shares of Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDA ICICI Lombard, ICICI Pru Life, among others, due to varied news developments and Q4 results.

Dr Reddy's asks several top-paid executives to quit in cost-cutting drive: ReportDr Reddy's Laboratories (DRL) FY24 annual report shows it had over 26,000 employees worldwide as of March 2024. That includes 21,757 permanent staff. In FY24, the company hired 6,281 people and spent Rs 5,030 crore on employee benefits,

entertainment.headline: Everyone is a He-Man... until the real He-Man arrives ft. Dharmendra. WatchAt 89, Dharmendra exudes incredible strength and spirit to stay healthy and relevant. In his latest video on Instagram, he inspires his fans to make wise health choices. Watch it here.

Johnny Depp is most handsome 'Day Drinker' in 1st look from Marc Webb's filmJohnny Depp is gearing up to make his much-awaited Hollywood feature comeback with Marc Webb's Day Drinker. He will reunite with Penélope Cruz in the upcoming thriller.

Broken leg, table and wheelchair in comedian Vir Das's Air India horror storyComedian and actor Vir Das narrated his experience with Air India in a long social media post. The Emmy-winning artiste explained how his flight with his wife turned into a nightmare due to the airline's complacency.

That's all AI could do: Radhikka Madan claps back at trolls over surgery rumoursRadhikka Madan responded to circulating rumours about her undergoing plastic surgery, which were sparked by a viral AI-generated video. The actor dismisses the claims with humour, urging people to continue their speculation.

Hit show Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah has a new Dayaben, finallyAsit Modi, producer of 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has a new update to share about having new Dayaben on board five years after Disha Vakani left the show.

Sharmila Tagore joins Naadaaniyan criticism: Ibrahim looked good, film didn'tVeteran actor Sharmila Tagore shared her thoughts on her grandson Ibrahim Ali Khan's debut film 'Nadaaniyan'. While she praised his appearance, she felt the film didn't meet expectations.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 5: Ajith's film on historic run domestically, worldwide Ajith's 'Good Bad Ugly' is creating records for both the actor and the Tamil film industry. The film's Monday business was strong, and it has already become the highest-grossing Tamil film of the year.

Jaat box office Day 5: Sunny Deol's film shows solid hold on 1st MondayAfter recording fabulous business on its first Sunday, Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' didn't disappoint with its Monday collection either. The film is expected to wrap up its first week on an impressive note now.

Never back down: Ranveer Allahbadia uplifts himself in inspiring Instagram postRanveer Allahbadia, also known as The Beer Biceps, shared a heartfelt message on Instagram, emphasising resilience and growth. This follows his recent controversy on India's Got Latent, which led to significant backlash and legal challenges.

Diddy pleads not guilty to expanded indictment: 'These are not new allegations'Sean "Diddy" Combs pleaded not guilty to expanded federal sex trafficking charges. Accused of exploiting women from 2004–2024, Combs denies all allegations. His trial begins in May amid mounting legal scrutiny.

Historic Blue Origin flight: Oprah Winfrey cheers on Gayle King's space journeyOprah Winfrey was emotional as Gayle King overcame her fear of flying to join Blue Origin's historic all-women spaceflight. The moment marked friendship, courage, and a step forward for women in space.

Harry Potter TV series: Who's been cast so far and what we knowHBO confirms casting for its Harry Potter series, including Nick Frost as Hagrid and Paapa Essiedu as Snape. The show begins filming in summer 2025 and premieres in 2026.

White Lotus star Aimee Lou Wood criticises SNL sketch as 'mean, unfunny'The White Lotus actor Aimee Lou Wood has voiced her disapproval of a recent SNL sketch that exaggerated her appearance with prosthetic teeth. The actor termed the parody 'mean and unfunny', suggesting it carried misogynistic undertones.
Salman Khan shares gym pics amid new death threat: Thank you for the motivationBollywood star Salman Khan shared new workout photos. This comes hours after he received a new death threat.

Alia Bhatt shares pic with her 'home' Ranbir Kapoor on their 3rd anniversaryAlia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor marked their third wedding anniversary with a heartfelt social media post. The couple, who first met on the sets of Brahmastra, share a glimpse of their journey together.

Fawad Khan, Vaani Kapoor reignite romance in Abir Gulaal's Khudaya Ishq songThe first song from the anticipated film 'Abir Gulaal', 'Khudaya Ishq', has captivated fans with its romance and chemistry between Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor. Sung by Arijit Singh and Shilpa Rao, the song highlights the themes of longing and unexpected love.

Katy Perry on why she sang What a Wonderful World in space: It's not about meKaty Perry joined an all-female crew on a Blue Origin space mission, where she sang 'What a Wonderful World'. The mission marked a historic moment with a focus on collective appreciation and future opportunities for women.

Akshay Kumar thanks PM for honouring Sankaran Nair: Kesari Chapter 2 is a reminderAkshay Kumar has reacted to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's praise for Sir C Sankaran Nair and his bold stand against British rule following the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. He thanked the PM for remembering Nair and acknowledging his contribution to India's freedom struggle.

Tu Mera Lover: Ravi Teja, Sreeleela dazzle together in Mass Jathara's first singleRavi Teja and Sreeleela dazzle in 'Tu Mera Lover', a high-energy track from 'Mass Jathara' that blends nostalgia, AI vocals, and mass appeal setting the stage for a box office storm.

general news.headline: Disappointed: Supreme Court slams UP over child trafficking, lays down guidelinesThe Supreme Court's tough talk came while it was hearing a case where a stolen baby was delivered to a couple in Uttar Pradesh who wanted a son.

Robert Vadra cries 'witch hunt' as ED summons him in Haryana land deal caseThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday summoned Robert Vadra for the second time in connection with its money-laundering probe linked to the Shikhopur land deal in Haryana.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

MS Dhoni reignites pitch controversy: Nobody wants to play timid cricketChennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni reignited the ongoing pitch controversy after their win against Lucknow Super Giants. Dhoni called for better pitches at their home in Chennai where they have lost 3 out of 4 matches.

Waqf violence: Is Bengal becoming a theatre of manufactured crises?In the poll run-up looms the grim prospect of complicit communal polarisation, of one party stoking majority anxieties and the other leveraging minority fears

Stay for 3 days, you'll get infected: Nitin Gadkari warns on Delhi air pollutionCiting a medical research, Nitin Gadkari warned that Delhi's pollution can cause infections within days and reduce life expectancy by 10 years.

Bangladeshi actor Meghna Alam arrested in night raid for 'threatening' Saudi tiesThe manner of her arrest has sparked a massive public outcry as the Bangladesh Police took her into custody after raiding her house late last Wednesday night while she was livestreaming on Facebook and claiming her innocence.

Karnataka woman beaten with sticks, pipes after husband's complaint at mosqueSix men were arrested in Davanagere, Karnataka for allegedly assaulting a 38-year-old woman outside a mosque after she was summoned in connection with a domestic dispute involving her husband.

Broken leg, table and wheelchair in comedian Vir Das's Air India horror storyComedian and actor Vir Das narrated his experience with Air India in a long social media post. The Emmy-winning artiste explained how his flight with his wife turned into a nightmare due to the airline's complacency.

Andhra man strangles wife just weeks before she was dueA man in Visakhapatnam killed his pregnant wife, who was just a few weeks away from delivering, in a fit of rage. The two had been married for two years.
Watch: Butterfingers JD Vance drops football trophy at White House photo opVice President JD Vance accidentally dropped Ohio State's national championship trophy during a White House photo op.

Radicalised people can't have nuclear weapons: Trump doubles down on IranDonald Trump, who has repeatedly threatened military action if no deal is reached on halting Iran's nuclear program, accused Tehran of 'intentionally' delaying a nuclear deal.

Felt like toilet paper: Singapore woman shares employee's brutal resignation noteIn a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Singapore-based businesswoman shared how an employee resigned, saying they felt like 'toilet paper' at their company.

$2.3 billion funding freeze: Trump targets Harvard University over defianceHarvard's USD 2.3 billion in funding was frozen by Donald Trump just hours after the university rejected a list of government demands, asserting that it would not surrender its independence.

Watch: MS Dhoni plays with robot dog, takes it with him after LSG vs CSKCSK captain MS Dhoni took IPL's latest tech - the robot dog - with him after the team's match against LSG. Dhoni, well known for his love of dogs, interacted with the robot dog and played with it after the match.

Sweden-based techie slams IndiGo, Air India over Rs 50,000 loss due to flight delayIn a now-viral post on LinkedIn, a Sweden-based Indian-origin techie slammed IndiGo and Air India after he claimed to have suffered a loss of Rs 50,000 due to a delayed domestic flight.

Watch: Virat Kohli teaches meditation in hilarious segment with Mr. NagsVirat Kohli sat down with RCB's Mr. Nags for a hilarious session of guided meditation. In the segment, Kohli spoke about RCB's chances of winning the title in the 18th year, and how his current relationship is with social media.

US visas are privilege, not a right: Marco Rubio to H-1B, green card holdersUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that US visas are a privilege, not a right, and pledged strict enforcement of visa laws under Donald Trump's rule.

Senior UP cop removed from Varanasi gangrape case days after PM's interventionSenior IPS officer Chandra Kant Meena was removed after PM Modi's intervention in the case pertaining to the alleged gang-rape of a Class 12 girl by as many as 23 men for 7 days in Varanasi.

Meta vs FTC: Zuckerberg defends Instagram, WhatsApp acquisitionsThe US FTC has accused Meta of illegally monopolising the social media market by acquiring competitors Instagram and WhatsApp to eliminate potential threats.

Volkswagen Tiguan R-Line review, first drive: VW's flagship SUV and first R-Line model in IndiaVolkswagen has launched its flagship SUV at Rs 49 lakh (ex-showroom). Can the brand-new Tiguan R-Line deliver on the promise of being a performance-oriented SUV? Is the Tiguan R-Line worth the aforementioned price tag? We took it out for a spin recently and tried to answer that question for you.

Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks collapse again as both sides hold firm on demandsAnother bid to end the Gaza war faltered as Cairo talks collapsed with no truce or hostage deal. Hamas demanded a full end to the war, while Israel sought the terror group's disarmament.

Not just the planet: The climate crisis is also affecting our mindsWhile not officially classified as a mental illness, eco-anxiety manifests through symptoms such as helplessness, guilt, and distress. This form of anxiety is particularly prevalent among younger generations who are deeply concerned about the world they will inherit.

IndusInd Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI: Why banking stocks are rising todayShares of IndusInd Bank gained above 6% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), while HDFC Bank was up 3.3%. Axis Bank shares rose nearly 3% and ICICI Bank was up 2.3%.

In the segment, Kohli spoke about RCB's chances of winning the title in the 18th year, and how his current relationship is with social media.

Watch: MS Dhoni plays with robot dog, takes it with him after LSG vs CSKCSK captain MS Dhoni took IPL's latest tech - the robot dog - with him after the team's match against LSG. Dhoni, well known for his love of dogs, interacted with the robot dog and played with it after the match.

Noor Ahmad is incredibly tough to read: CSK bowling coachIPL 2025: Chennai Super Kings bowling coach Eric Simmons praised Afghan spinner Noor Ahmad after his incredible four over spell vs Lucknow. Simmons said that he has been coaching for years, but he has never seen someone as difficult to read as Noor Ahamd.

Zen MS Dhoni teaches CSK how cricket should be played: Bowling coachChennai Super Kings bowling coach Eric Simons spoke about the impact of MS Dhoni in the team. Under Dhoni's leadership CSK were able to break the 5-match losing streak and secure a win vs Lucknow Super Giants.

Ravi Bishnoi defends Rishabh Pant for not completing his quota vs CSKIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: In the post-match press conference, leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi defended Rishabh Pant for not completing his quota of four overs despite bowling well in his first three overs against Chennai Super Kings.

Intent, intent and more intent: CSK's new approach under Dhoni finds the winCSK showed intent for the first time in a long time during their win against LSG as their losing streak came to an end. Under MS Dhoni, the players need to keep the new found aggression going to mount a possible comeback in IPL 2025.

MS Dhoni reignites pitch controversy: Nobody wants to play timid cricketChennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni reignited the ongoing pitch controversy after their win against Lucknow Super Giants. Dhoni called for better pitches at their home in Chennai where they have lost 3 out of 4 matches.

Michael Clarke reveals where Rishabh Pant missed the trick to put pressure on CSKFormer Australia cricketer-turned commentator Michael Clarke mentioned where Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain Rishabh Pant got it wrong against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Match 30 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Watch: MS Dhoni consoles Rishabh Pant after LSG lose close contest vs CSKIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni consoled Rishabh Pant as Lucknow Super Giants couldn't prevail in their last-over thriller against Chennai Super Kings on Monday at the Ekana Stadium.

MS Dhoni is still the best wicketkeeper in the world: Michael ClarkeIPL 2025: Former Australia cricketer Michael Clarke said that Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni is still the best wicketkeeper in the world at the age of 43.

Ramandeep Singh eager to be KKR's finisher in IPL 2025: Want to be a match-winnerRamandeep Singh has stated that he wants to be the finisher for KKR this season in the IPL. Ramandeep said that he wants to back himself and become a match-winner for the side this season.

MS Dhoni reignites pitch controversy: Nobody wants to play timid cricketChennai Super Kings captain MS Dhoni reignited the ongoing pitch controversy after their win against Lucknow Super Giants. Dhoni called for better pitches at their home in Chennai where they have lost 3 out of 4 matches.

Michael Clarke reveals where Rishabh Pant missed the trick to put pressure on CSKFormer Australia cricketer-turned commentator Michael Clarke mentioned where Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain Rishabh Pant got it wrong against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in Match 30 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Watch: MS Dhoni consoles Rishabh Pant after LSG lose close contest vs CSKIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni consoled Rishabh Pant as Lucknow Super Giants couldn't prevail in their last-over thriller against Chennai Super Kings on Monday at the Ekana Stadium.

MS Dhoni is still the best wicketkeeper in the world: Michael ClarkeIPL 2025: Former Australia cricketer Michael Clarke said that Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain MS Dhoni is still the best wicketkeeper in the world at the age of 43.

Ramandeep Singh eager to be KKR's finisher in IPL 2025: Want to be a match-winnerRamandeep Singh has stated that he wants to be the finisher for KKR this season in the IPL. Ramandeep said that he wants to back himself and become a match-winner for the side this season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
